#summary SetupMarsRobotProject
= Setup Mars Robot Project =

 # Install Oracle Java VM
  e.g. on Ubuntu Linux check that `/usr/bin/java` point to Oracle Java VM.
 # Download Java 3D
  Download the Java 3D API Version *1.4.0_01* from [http://java3d.java.net/binary-builds-old.html]. Note: the latest version of Java 3D API does *NOT* work
{{{
curl http://download.java.net/media/java3d/builds/release/1.4.0_01/java3d-1_4_0_01-linux-i586.bin
./java3d-1_4_0_01-linux-i586.bin
}}}
 # Install Java 3D API into the JRE
  e.g. install Java 3D on Ubuntu Linux, change into the JRE directory and run the Java 3D API install script
{{{
cd /usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun
/home/osgi/Downloads/java3d-1_4_0_01-linux-i586.bin
}}}
 # Checkout the Mars Robot Project from SCM
{{{
svn checkout https://svn.codespot.com/a/eclipselabs.org/occ/trunk marsrobot
}}}
 # Build the Mars Robot with Maven
{{{
cd marsrobot
mvn clean install
}}}
 # Run the Robot via PAX Runner
{{{
mvn pax:run
}}}
 # Import the Project into Eclipse
{{{
mvn eclipse:eclipse 
}}}
